sentences.sContent: Somewhat less than 40% of people in the world retain the ability to digest lactose after childhood.
sentences.sContent_eng: Somewhat less than 40% of people in the world retain the ability to digest lactose after childhood.
sentences.sCn: 全世界大约不到40%的成年人能够在童年过后保留消化乳糖的能力。

sentences.sContent: Some people have trouble digesting lactose, a carbohydrate in milk and milk products, because of the deficiency of enzyme lactase in the body.
sentences.sContent_eng: Some people have trouble digesting lactose, a carbohydrate in milk and milk products, because of the deficiency of enzyme lactase in the body.
sentences.sCn: 有些人无法消化乳糖，一种在牛奶和奶制品中的碳水化合物，这是因为在他们的身体中缺少乳糖消化酶。

sentences.sContent: Though children were able to drink milk, they typically developed lactose intolerance as they grew up.
sentences.sContent_eng: Though children were able to drink milk, they typically developed lactose intolerance as they grew up.
sentences.sCn: 虽然小孩喝牛奶没有问题，但在长大后他们通常都会产生乳糖不耐受。

trans.tranOther: a type of sugar found in milk, sometimes used as a food for babies and sick people
